alert.note: Alert for Austin; Colorado; Fort Bend; Wharton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 17 at 1:55PM CDT until May 19 at 2:12PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... San Bernard River Near East Bernard affecting Fort Bend, Wharton, Austin and Colorado Counties. For the San Bernard River...including East Bernard, Sweeny, Boling... Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...San Bernard River Near East Bernard. * WHEN...Until early Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding begins in the vicinity of the gage with minor roads along the river inundated. Backwater flooding up Britt Branch and Bratcher Slough begins. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:00 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 17.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:00 PM CDT Wednesday was 19.4 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 18.5 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage early Friday morning to 16.2 feet Friday evening. It will rise to 16.4 feet early Saturday afternoon. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.5 feet on 04/19/2015. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat San Bernard River East Bernard 17.0 17.9 Wed 1 pm CDT 18.2 16.3 16.4 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning at 800 AM CDT.
